description: TPO 804 A2 1 x Weeping Willow to reduce limb (as per diagram) by 30-50%
decision_conditions: The removal of deadwood, dangerous / hanging branches and ivy:  This does not require the formal consent of the Council.

Statutory crown lifting of trees: This does not require formal consent of the Council if the clearance only involves the removal of branches to give a separation between the footway and the tips of the lowest branches by up to 2.3m or the carriageway by up to 5.2m.
The mature Willow tree is situated in the rear garden of the property. It is in good condition and can be seen by surrounding neighbours.

The tree has a secondary limb that is the concern of this application, however removing a large amount of this could cause the limb to be shut off from the crown and die. This could lead to an imbalance in the crown. The limb is currently part of the biomechanics of the trees system.
This application is refused as there is no evidence to suggest reducing this limb would be beneficial to the tree.
